website_summaries.verdict: The BenQ BL3201PH is a massive 32-inch In-Plane Switching (IPS) monitor designed for CAD/CAM and graphic arts professionals. It delivers very accurate colors, wide viewing angles, and sharp 4K images.
The BenQ PD3200U is a well-equipped 32-inch display that delivers very good color, grayscale, and viewing-angle performance, as well as a highly detailed UHD picture.

customer_reviews.title: Bad light bleed in three corners.
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor except that had bad light bleed in three corners. Unacceptable for a premium monitor at this price. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B. UK

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality and functionality
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a designer and don't use CAD but I do appreciate 4K and also edit 4K video and lots of hi-res photos. This Benq PD3200U has all of the features I need (and plenty more that I don't really). I love the puck control and the in-built KVM functionality as well as the USB 3 sockets. The eye protection and power saving eco functions are also of great value to me and they work impeccably. Whilst it represents good value it remains an expensive item but having used it now everyday for many weeks, I feel that cost fully justified.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Snapper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: After a while of using the screen, and since we are working from home, I am using the screen for a very long hours during the day and sometimes the night. The screen deserves a five stars. So far so good - fit for purpose. Very good quality, the colors are there and the resolution is good. I will say you will get what you paid for. I have spend a lot of time searching for a good design screen, I think this one is a medium price good 32'' screen. This is the first time I subscribe to the BenQ but so far so good. I am quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ameur

customer_reviews.title: Great product aside the occasional screen flicker and burn in
customer_reviews.text: Have had this product for quite some time now for normal day to day Revit work it is incredible cant fault it. However... the screen has a tendency to flicker at random times lasts for a split second but is very obvious. happens around once or twice a week without fail. Screen burn in is an annoyance that when the background of the display is changed to grey when editing you can see the previous image burned in temporarily. Its not obvious in most scenarios but the times you do occasionally see it can be annoying. This is really nitpicking but all around great monitor would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shiv1990

customer_reviews.title: Good for working from home.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this (pre-lockdown) for working from home when previous smaller monitor failed. Used primarily for word processing, spreadsheets, and light web browsing. Have watched a few films and it's excellent. Screen refresh rates and color accuracy are fine for my non-professional/non-gamer needs. Can usefully view two documents side-by-side. Pixel density is very high so text is crystal clear, but you might have to magnify some documents to see smaller text. Used four months so far with no problems. Multiple video and USB connections (in and out) are useful, and up/down/tilt adjustability make it easy to find a good working position. Overall good value for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: taugei

customer_reviews.title: fantastic monitor, good size
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a 27" 4K, makes the 27" Benq adjacent look small. I use mine for CAD and photography mainly, and for me it's ideal. Maybe my eyesight is going a bit, so the screen size is ideal for me, and although same 4K resolution it feels you can get more on the screen as windows can be made smaller. I want another one!
customer_reviews.author: Jon L

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor. Really crisp image, colours are right, it looks good from many angles. It has four graphics inputs (2 HDMI, 2 DP) and acts as a USB 3 hub and USB can switch between 2 computers. It is not possible to switch video and USB at the same time though. I customised the buttons on the hotkey puck to help with this, but there are only 3 on there, 4 would have been better. Be aware of the USB awake setting in the menu - you'll need that on so your mouse/keyboard have power when the monitor is off so you can wake your PC.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Metcalfe

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor but KVM switching is BAD!
customer_reviews.text: I won't do a big review yet but watch out, this monitor is great (outstanding screen) but the KVM switch is poorly implimented. To those of you who switch PCs many times a day this simply won't cut it. Amazingly, the keyboard and mouse controls don't switch when the video signals switch. You have to switch the keyboard and mouse via multiple button presses (I counted 6) within the OSD. To me, this completely defeats the point. Apparently the next gen puck (on newer monitor models) features combined switching. Doh!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Carter

customer_reviews.title: A great 32" 4K monitor
customer_reviews.text: Really lots to like about this - preset calibrations, card reader, picture quality, adjustability. I can't think of a thing to mark it down on other than it's style - other manufacturers seem to make much more stylish monitors! I have owned many monitors over the last 10 years (I run an IT and photo business) but this is the best so far...
customer_reviews.author: clive wagner

customer_reviews.title: Below Average
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, the built in speakers are the cheapest, tinniest, thinest sounding things it has ever been my misfortune to listen to since I was a kid with a crytal radio listening to radio luxenburgh under the blankets. A number of sockets - not very reliable, doesn't seem to work as a USB hub, couldn't get the Thunderbolt port (USB3) to do anything. A really clear picture, though, and the construction is robust with an excellent stand for easy re-positioning.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Gater

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE PD3200U BenQ MONITOR !!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this BenQ MONITOR !! Amazing accurate / sharpe / and backlight very evenly installed I've divided screen for 3 portrait "views" or 6 smaller "views" or 4 (2 portrait + 2 small) "views" So, ONE screen 32inch - and allow to display 6 smaller views (approx. 1200px x 1000px each) or more (if you are able to read smaller windows - so, 12 or 18 views is possible) Unlimited setup !! Nice colours - BlueMode - REC709 BUY BUY BUY BUY SW320 is this same like PD3200U but twice cheaper (but no ShadowHood and no ColourMeter)
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing contrast ratio. The blacks bleed a lot of light through.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this is all you can expect at this price point but the blacks allow a lot of backlight to bleed through. I bought this monitor to replace two ageing 22" 1080p panels. It does that very well. You can easily snap two or more windows next to each other. I can't see the pixels so text is sharp. Unfortunately, I am disappointed with the black levels it can achieve and found I had to turn the panel brightness down quite a long way to minimise the eyestrain of staring into a huge bright display.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor - replaced a single 24" 1920x1200 so I've got lots of extra room. Glad I went for 32" rather than 27" or 29" as I think they'd be too small at 4k resolution. Speakers are (as you'd expect) only ok but they do buzz if nothing's playing through them (mute the computer's sound and the buzzing stops) hence the deducted star.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Baldrick

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor I wish I'd bought sooner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor we're using primarily for photo editing and general day-to-day use. Super clear picture and very easy to set up and install. Make sure you have a good chair so you can sit at the right height as it's quite tall as well as wide. At this resolution working on multiple windows at once is practical - and it's great to see photos at high resolution in all their glory. Reassuringly it comes calibrated too - to my untrained eye the colours certainly look very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan M. Sturdy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality monitor, lots of settings and options
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quality monitor. I use it for general computing and esp. for 3D work. It's sharp and hi-red - so much so that standard webpages and email screens can be a bit small - and seems to be very high quality. I find the built in KVM switch and dual video input particularly useful as I can switch between machines, PC and Mac, without changing keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Matthew C. Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: So clear!
customer_reviews.text: The picture is so clear! I'm sitting 2ft away from the screen and I can not distinguish any pixels or screen defects whatsoever. Good range of settings available from buttons in front of the screen as well. Drawback: the software does not work on Linux.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality & Design
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a replacement for a Dell monitor(fed up with Dells Display port issues & placement of connections). The Benq monitor is top quality with a great design. Will not buy another Dell, Benq will be my first buy.
customer_reviews.author: Carbonised Eye sockets

customer_reviews.title: Accurate color and sharp screen with good design, slight buzz
customer_reviews.text: The color profiles are great allowing you to easily switch between them. Screen has some slight unevenness in brightness and a bit of edge bleed in a dark room. If you have sensitive hearing, there is a slight buzz in the power system. As usual with monitors, the speakers are the low point. As a photographer I recommend this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Schuster

customer_reviews.title: Great for picture editing and a great choice if you want a large screen for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor for those who enjoy a big screen for gaming and picture editing. One tip, if you use multiple screens you will struggle to use a small screen alongside this and I intend on using a bigger 2nd screen soon.
customer_reviews.author: Primm Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t use this one for games. But it’s definitely a life changing product. I could never go back to the small screens. It is very heavy though. The sound system is not great.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Does the job nicely
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the money, used for graphics and photography on my Mac. Leads that come with the monitor are cheap and can make your monitor blink so i highly recommend you get a high quality display port cable.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality monitor, plenty of connections. Used as a replacement for an old Apple cinema display. Used in conjunction with a Hanns-G monitor and Optoma projector running off a MacBook Pro - works beautifully. Great build quality. Delivery excellent. I can't fault this.
customer_reviews.author: JC, FileMaker Developer

customer_reviews.title: Very good image, especially colour accuracy, for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a Samsung which was two and a half times the price but failed after 4 years. Colour accuracy very good. Used for photography with a Canon 5D Mk iv. Don't know what it is like for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: droid

customer_reviews.title: Ideal monitor for 4k editing
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product ideal for 4k editing so good brought 2 of them
customer_reviews.author: trizza

customer_reviews.title: 4k screen great
customer_reviews.text: Got after lock down to use for work purposes and personal purposes Great 4k picture
customer_reviews.author: RAJ

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic in every way
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor for a professional graphics designer, or anything in-between. I am blown away by the quality of the picture, it really is a Rolls-Royce of monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Gravitas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor for use with Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my MacBook Pro for Photo editing. The monitor is excellent quality and it echoes the resolution of the Mac. You do need to remember to purchase the connecting cable but once done - excellent.
customer_reviews.author: A W.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I did not realise how big 32inch is for a desk setup, I am a video editor and absolutely love it. The 4K is extremely crisp and the eyecare must work as I have not found my eyes straining at all after long hours editing. It came very securely packaged and extremely easy to set up Thanks BenQ!
customer_reviews.author: ben s.

customer_reviews.title: Flicker issue is still present
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is great, but the model still has the famous black flickering issue. BenQ's reps are all over the Internet saying it's been solved, but I guess they didn't get around to fixing this batch...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Williams

customer_reviews.title: Pro monitor
customer_reviews.text: Awesome monitor I use this for reading architectural drawings also a few cheaky YouTube videos etc etc ;) great quality all round bright clear and great colour range.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very good monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it for a few days - but I have processed some images using this screen and its a pleasure to work with.
customer_reviews.author: PaulF

customer_reviews.text: This monitor is absolutely superb! Huge value for money. Vast picture expanse. Absolutely 10/10 for the mony. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheriffofworksop

customer_reviews.title: Great for photo editing but not for playing games as ...
customer_reviews.text: Upgrade from a 24" monitor, well made with lots of features. Great for photo editing but not for playing games as it's not fast enough. Works with my MAC mini through the display port although not at 4K
customer_reviews.author: JaJa Binks

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with it's quality and the price. No dead pixles or dust which I had seen in the reviews. The screen is a good IPS, and I do motion graphic designing and a bit of coding. Did flicker a few times, maybe once too many, but now the flickering is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Alireza

customer_reviews.title: setup
customer_reviews.text: 4k quality outstanding Great split screen capability although had to download drivers cd didnt work Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ian Mussard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Superb screen, so much real estate to use for multiple apps running alongside each other. Good and easy to switch between various sources
customer_reviews.author: C Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: fantastic picture, I find I can read the text at 100% and don't have to magnify. Seems huge on the desk compared to the 27" monitor, definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Pure garbage, has blackout pretty much every 2 minutes despite updating all the software etc ... Totally unacceptable
customer_reviews.author: Florian

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.. not worth.....
customer_reviews.text: Not bad.. not worth the money should be around £400 for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Howlett Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture quality for photo editing and watching films. Not sure about high end gaming
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor! Without any issues
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor! Without any issues. Highly recommended. Just the built-in speakers are useless but it's a monitor so that was expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The monitor satisfied all my expectations. 4K and size are great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor for work and leasure.
customer_reviews.text: I love the overall quality of the monitor and user experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for 4K
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is really great I really love it. BenQ PD3200U 32-inch 4K Designer Monitor
customer_reviews.author: Haidar

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!! i throughly enjoying it
customer_reviews.text: Its been almost 3 months since i bought this product !!So far so good !! i throughly enjoying it 11
customer_reviews.author: muralikrishna

product_meta.title: BenQ PD3200U 32 Inch 4K Graphic Design Monitor, 3840 x 2160 UHD, IPS,100% Rec.709, sRGB, CAD/CAM, Animation, Darkroom Mode, KVM, Hotkey Puck, DualView, Flicker-free, HDMI, DP
product_meta.description:
Size Name:32 Inch (UHD)| Style Name:Monitor for Designer| Pattern Name:PD3200UDesigned to meet the rising demands for large-sized viewing and ultra-high definition, the PD3200U boasts a 32 inch wide 4K display built with BenQ's advanced IPS technology, providing creative professionals over 300 per cent working space to work confidently in 100 per cent sRGB and Rec. 709 colour spaces. Revolutionary CAD/CAM, animation and darkroom modes enhance display settings to bring out the details of intricate designs into view.VESA Wall Mount

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Product is sourced and shipped from the European Economic Area (EEA). Product is genuine original from manufacturer authorized distributors.

BOX CONTAINS
Monitor
UK power lead

See more
feature_bullets: AQCOLOUR technology: factory-calibrated100% sRGB and Rec.709 colour space of accurate colours for professional creative work
Dualview function: Work in two modes such as sRGB and darkroom mode without the need for two screens
Darkroom, CAD/CAM and animation display mode: Revolutionary modes bring out the details of intricate designs into view
Keyboard video mouse (KVM) switch: Display contents from two PC systems using one set of keyboard and mouse
Eye-care technology: Flicker-free technology reduce eye discomfort. Card Reader: SD/MMC type, support Format: SD/SDHC/SDXC/MMC. LED backlight. Brightness 350 cd per metre square
Mac Compatible : Yes, Solidworks : Yes, Windows Compatible : Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows 7
